repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
**Problems:**

- `vim.treesitter.language.inspect()` returns duplicate symbol names, sometimes up to 6 of one kind in the case of `markdown`. This is especially annoying in the omnifunc which gives many superfluous results
- The list-like `symbols` table can have holes and is thus not even a valid msgpack table anyway, mentioned in a test

**Solution:** Return symbols as a map, rather than a list, where field names are the names of the symbol. The boolean value associated with the field encodes whether or not the symbol is named.

Note that anonymous nodes are surrounded with double quotes (`"`) to prevent potential collisions with named counterparts that have the same identifier.

comment_data.body:
I would use stack memory here. Other functions in this file use `char ebuf[BUFSIZE]` where `BUFSIZE=256`.

Also other functions use `vim_snprintf`. Not sure if that is preferred over `snprintf`? @justinmk

> other functions use `vim_snprintf`. Not sure if that is preferred over `snprintf`

I'm not aware of any reason to prefer `vim_snprintf` for cases where `snprintf` works just as well (and that seems to avoid an extra layer). We currently don't have clear guidance on this, but if someone knows better then we can write that down.

No objection either way for this PR.

- can use `sizeof(buf)` because its size is statically declared.
- ~~can we use single-quotes since that matches our style guidelines?~~

```suggestion
      snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "\"%s\"", name);
```

single-quotes since that matches our style guidelines? cc @clason 

related: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/28330

```suggestion
    Anonymous nodes are surrounded with quotes (`'`).
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1137,8 +1137,13 @@ get_lang({filetype})                      *vim.treesitter.language.get_lang()*
 inspect({lang})                            *vim.treesitter.language.inspect()*
     Inspects the provided language.
 
-    Inspecting provides some useful information on the language like node
-    names, ...
+    Inspecting provides some useful information on the language like node and
+    field names, ABI version, and whether the language came from a WASM
+    module.
+
+    Node names are returned in a table mapping each node name to a `boolean`
+    indicating whether or not the node is named (i.e., not anonymous).
+    Anonymous nodes are surrounded with double quotes (`"`).

comment_data.body: But double quotes is how tree-sitter denotes anonymous nodes -- both in the playground (our `:InspectTree` and in the queries.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1137,8 +1137,13 @@ get_lang({filetype})                      *vim.treesitter.language.get_lang()*
 inspect({lang})                            *vim.treesitter.language.inspect()*
     Inspects the provided language.
 
-    Inspecting provides some useful information on the language like node
-    names, ...
+    Inspecting provides some useful information on the language like node and
+    field names, ABI version, and whether the language came from a WASM
+    module.
+
+    Node names are returned in a table mapping each node name to a `boolean`
+    indicating whether or not the node is named (i.e., not anonymous).
+    Anonymous nodes are surrounded with double quotes (`"`).

comment_data.body: I think this decl can be moved to line 280 since that is the block it is pushed into Lua.
I thought about that, I initially put it outside that block for less stack allocations (but those are cheap ofc...). Do you think readability suffers with it outside that block? I'll move it in if so
Our coding rules require moving all variable to the most local scope. This generally makes refactoring and moving code around much easier.

comment_regular_data.body:
I think the change is fine; we have nowhere documented what kind of "useful info" this returns. From a quick Github search, this seems to be mainly used as a "has_parser" check, so the actual return value is irrelevant.

I wouldn't even consider it "breaking" for that reason (and no news entry required).
ASAN failure is consistent, though, so I'd double-check the `treesitter.c` changes.
It'd be also great to have the luadoc updated in `treesitter/language.lua` (as well as vimdoc for `|vim.treesitter.language.inspect()|` rendered).

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(treesitter): remove duplicate symbol names in language.inspect()
